summary: This OIG memorandum details the analysis of surveillance video from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit (SHU) on August 9-10, 2019, surrounding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It documents staff assignments, rounds, counts, and movements, revealing failures to conduct required checks and staff sleeping on duty. This document is a detailed timeline analysis of Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) Special Housing Unit (SHU) surveillance footage from the night of August 9-10, 2019, documenting the movements of correctional officers and inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It is part of an investigation (Case Number: 2019-009707) into the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) on the L tier of the SHU on August 10, 2019. The document details his movements on the evening of August 9, including being escorted from an attorney conference, receiving a phone call, and being returned to his cell.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Assigned to the SHU on August 9 (4 p.m. to 12 a.m.) and August 10 (12 a.m. to 8 a.m.). The report states she and another officer prefilled count sheets, did not conduct counts or rounds from 12 a.m. to 6 a.m., and was present when Epstein was found.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: Assigned to work in the SHU from 12 a.m. until 8 a.m. on August 10, 2019. Admitted to prefilling count and round sheets and not conducting counts or rounds from 12 a.m. to 6 a.m.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: A correctional officer frequently seen moving around the SHU, interacting with other COs, and performing duties such as counts and delivering meals. Her statements to the OIG are referenced.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Identified from the daily roster as a CO who reported for his shift at Door 46 at 00:01 on August 10.

connections.description: Both were assigned to the SHU on the morning watch shift of August 10, 2019, and admitted to jointly prefilling count sheets and failing to conduct required rounds and counts.
Noel is documented escorting Epstein, providing him with a meal, and performing counts related to his cell tier.
Frequently seen moving together, coordinating duties around the SHU desk area and during shift changes.
Thomas was on duty during the shift when Epstein was in his cell, though direct interaction in this footage is less specific than with Noel.

events.title: Epstein's Evening Activities in SHU
events.description: Epstein was escorted from an attorney conference to the SHU G tier shower cell at ~6:53 p.m., given a legal phone call until ~7:19 p.m., escorted back to his L tier cell at ~7:49 p.m., and provided dinner at ~8:39 p.m.

events.title: Failure to Conduct 10 p.m. Count
events.description: Video review shows Tova Noel walked SHU tiers alone between 10:30-10:36 p.m., which the OIG interprets as a round, not the required two-officer count. The 10 p.m. count sheet was marked 'good verbal' by a control officer.

events.title: Staff Sleeping and Falsified Counts
events.description: From 12 a.m. to 6 a.m., Tova Noel and Thomas admitted to prefilling count and round sheets and not conducting any counts or rounds. Video showed little to no movement, with staff appearing to sleep at the desk.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: At approximately 6:30 a.m., Thomas found Epstein and told Noel he had hung himself. Noel activated her body alarm at ~6:33 a.m. Multiple COs responded to L tier.

events.title: Epstein Moved to Cell
events.description: At 19:49, a CO escorted Jeffrey Epstein from G tier across the SHU floor and up to L tier, returning him to his cell.

events.title: Meal Delivery to Epstein
events.description: At approximately 20:39, Noel is seen carrying what appeared to be a food tray toward L tier, consistent with her statement about providing Epstein with his meal.

events.title: Shift Change and Rounds
events.description: Multiple officer shift changes and scheduled counts occur throughout the night (10 p.m., 12 a.m., 3 a.m., 5 a.m.), documented by officer movement to and from the 10S office.

events.title: Breakfast Preparation
events.description: Between 6:22 and 6:34, multiple COs, including Noel and Thomas, are seen hurriedly moving food trays and a cart, suggesting breakfast delivery to the SHU.

keyFacts: Only one surveillance camera inside the SHU was recording on August 9-10, 2019, providing a limited, low-quality view of the common area and stairs to some tiers.
Correctional Officers Tova Noel and Thomas admitted to prefilling count and round sheets and failing to conduct any counts or rounds from 12 a.m. to 6 a.m. on August 10, 2019.
Video analysis indicated staff were likely sleeping at the SHU officer's desk for extended periods during the early morning hours of August 10.
The last time a correctional officer was seen on video entering the L tier where Epstein was housed was at 10:39 p.m. on August 9, until the discovery at ~6:30 a.m. on August 10.
The OIG's analysis contradicts initial BOP employee statements that all SHU cameras were broadcasting live; the FBI found only one was recording.
The document provides a minute-by-minute log of officer and inmate movement in the MCC SHU on the night leading up to Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Correctional Officer Noel is a central figure, performing multiple counts, delivering a meal to Epstein's cell on L tier, and frequently moving around the unit.
The footage shows Epstein being escorted from G tier back to his cell on L tier at 19:49 on August 9.
The log documents standard prison routines (meal delivery, counts, shift changes) alongside periods of heightened activity, such as around 6:30 AM.
The analysis is part of an official investigation (Case Number: 2019-009707) into the circumstances of Epstein's death.
